title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/rredlist.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version rredlist ropensci/rredlist) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/rredlist.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Run tests! Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/rredlist

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: package uses vcr top testthat testing: HTTP requests responses saved running tests, cached things (“cassettes”) used instead repeated calls web services. ’re new testing setup, read HTTP testing R. practice, means: new tests add vcr::use_cassette() around function calls use HTTP, around whole tests. Check existing test files. Running new test first time create cassettes tests/fixtures/ (.e., YAML files containing HTTP requests response). Please commit cassette test. edit HTTP request function test making, delete corresponding cassette running tests. commit changes cassette changes test. rredlist requires API key work. testing locally, need use API key generate new cassettes. API key normally recorded HTTP requests responses. However, ’ve set vcr filters sensitive data cassettes. Make sure never include API key making changes codebase, including tests.

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: redlistr different package contributors IUCN Red List - working IUCN Red List API. rredlist include support spatial API, described https://apiv3.iucnredlist.org/spatial.

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: CRAN Development version
code: install.packages("rredlist") # From GitHub remotes::install_github("ropensci/rredlist")  # From r-universe install.packages("rredlist", repos = "https://ropensci.r-universe.dev/")

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: rredlist versions ≤ 0.7.1 tracked version 3 IUCN Red List API. rredlist versions ≥ 1.0.0 track version 4 IUCN Red List API. need use version 3 API–still functioning–can install old version rredlist using remotes package:
code: # From CRAN archive remotes::install_version("rredlist", version = "0.7.1")  # From r-universe remotes::install_version("rredlist", version = "0.7.1",                          repos = "https://ropensci.r-universe.dev/")

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: IUCN requires get API key, alphanumeric string need send every request. ’s helper function package helping getting https://api.iucnredlist.org/users/sign_up storing . store key, functions rredlist always default using key. Keep key private. can pass key function via key parameter, ’s better store key either environment variable (IUCN_REDLIST_KEY) R option (iucn_redlist_key) - recommend using former option. Note can longer generate new API key version 3 API.
code: rredlist::rl_use_iucn()

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: Query assessments taxa (e.g., rl_species() rl_family()) Query assessments habitats (e.g., rl_habitats() rl_systems()) Query assessments geography (e.g., rl_countries() rl_realms()) Query assessments actions needed (e.g., rl_actions() rl_research()) Query assessments threat details (e.g., rl_threats() rl_pop_trends()) Query assessments specific sets taxa (e.g., rl_extinct() rl_growth_forms()) Get details single assessment (e.g., rl_species_latest() rl_assessment()) Red List information statistics (e.g., rl_sp_count() rl_version())

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: High level functions HTTP request parse data list ease downstream use. high level functions underscore end function name, e.g., rl_species(). return long lists containing lots different information: default, high level functions also parse data data.frame, possible: Likely bit faster parse list , take extra data.frame parsing time: even speed, use low level package interface.
code: library("rredlist") rl_species("Fratercula", "arctica") #> $taxon #> $taxon$sis_id #> [1] 22694927 #>  #> $taxon$scientific_name #> [1] "Fratercula arctica" #>  #> $taxon$species_taxa #> list() #>  ... rl_species("Fratercula", "arctica")$assessments #>    year_published latest sis_taxon_id                                                    url assessment_id #> 1            2021   TRUE     22694927 https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/166290968     166290968 #> 2            2018   TRUE     22694927 https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/132581443     132581443 #> 3            2017  FALSE     22694927 https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/117606911     117606911 #> 4            2016  FALSE     22694927  https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/93477427      93477427 #> 5            2017  FALSE     22694927 https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/110638141     110638141 #> 6            2015  FALSE     22694927  https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/82593109      82593109 #> 7            2015  FALSE     22694927  https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/60110592      60110592 #> 8            2012  FALSE     22694927  https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/38908739      38908739 #> 9            2009  FALSE     22694927  https://www.iucnredlist.org/species/22694927/28178290      28178290 ... rl_species("Fratercula", "arctica", parse = FALSE)$assessments #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$year_published #> [1] "2021" #>  #> [[1]]$latest #> [1] TRUE #>  #> [[1]]$sis_taxon_id #> [1] 22694927 #>  ...

title: Introduction to rredlist
text: IUCN folks: “many frequent calls, many calls per day might get access blocked temporarily. ’re heavy API user, Red List Unit asked contact , might better options. suggest 2-second delay calls plan make lot calls.”

title: IUCN Red List Client
text: rredlist R client IUCN Red List API (https://api.iucnredlist.org). IUCN Red List world’s comprehensive information source global extinction risk status animal, fungus plant species. package provides access via R various data contained within database span range details, population size, habitat ecology, use /trade, threats, conservation actions.

title: IUCN Red List Client
text: CRAN Development version
code: install.packages("rredlist") remotes::install_github("ropensci/rredlist") # OR install.packages("rredlist", repos = "https://ropensci.r-universe.dev/")

title: IUCN Red List Client
text: Use package requires IUCN API key can acquired https://api.iucnredlist.org/users/sign_up. helper function help get key store properly: Keep key private. can pass key function via key parameter, ’s better store key either environment variable (IUCN_REDLIST_KEY) R option (iucn_redlist_key) - recommend using former option. Note default API key used fallback, package function without providing/storing API key.
code: rredlist::rl_use_iucn()

title: IUCN Red List Client
code: library("rredlist")

what: Conservation actions needed assessment summary — rl_actions
title: Conservation actions needed assessment summary — rl_actions
text: Return latest assessments given conservation action needed (e.g., Land/water management Species recovery). conservation action codes correspond IUCN Red List Conservation Actions Classification Scheme (v2.0).

title: Conservation actions needed assessment summary — rl_actions
code: rl_actions(   code = NULL,   key = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   all = TRUE,   page = 1,   quiet = FALSE,   ... )  rl_actions_(code = NULL, key = NULL, all = TRUE, page = 1, quiet = FALSE, ...)

title: Conservation actions needed assessment summary — rl_actions
text: code (character) code conservation action look . supplied, list conservation actions returned. key (character) IUCN API token. See rl_use_iucn. parse (logical) Whether parse output list (FALSE) , possible, data.frame (TRUE). Default: TRUE (logical) Whether retrieve results . TRUE paging internally bind results together. FALSE, single page results retrieved. page (integer/numeric) Page get FALSE. Default: 1. page returns 100 records. Paging required much burden server just "get data" one request. quiet (logical) Whether suppress progress multi-page downloads . Default: FALSE (, give progress). Ignored = FALSE. ... Includes following filters supported API endpoint (refer API docs information): year_published: (integer) Set return assessments given year. latest: (logical) Set TRUE return latest assessment taxon. scope_code: (integer) Set return assessments particular scope (e.g., 1 Global, 2 Europe). similar region argument old Red List API old versions rredlist. Also supports curl options passed GET request via HttpClient.

text: list unless using function trailing underscore, case json character string returned.

what: Red List category assessment summary — rl_categories
title: Red List category assessment summary — rl_categories
text: Return list latest assessments given category (e.g., Evaluated, Data Deficient, Least Concern, Near Threatened, Vulnerable, Endangered, Critically Endangered, Extinct Wild Extinct). endpoint returns categories current IUCN Red List Categories Criteria (v3.1) well older versions (.e., v2.3). Note code may unique across Categories Criteria versions. Therefore, codes like "EX" return assessments EX v3.1 EX v2.3.

title: Stress assessment summary — rl_stresses
text: code (character) code stress look . supplied, list stresses returned. key (character) IUCN API token. See rl_use_iucn. parse (logical) Whether parse output list (FALSE) , possible, data.frame (TRUE). Default: TRUE (logical) Whether retrieve results . TRUE paging internally bind results together. FALSE, single page results retrieved. page (integer/numeric) Page get FALSE. Default: 1. page returns 100 records. Paging required much burden server just "get data" one request. quiet (logical) Whether suppress progress multi-page downloads . Default: FALSE (, give progress). Ignored = FALSE. ... Includes following filters supported API endpoint (refer API docs information): year_published: (integer) Set return assessments given year. latest: (logical) Set TRUE return latest assessment taxon. scope_code: (integer) Set return assessments particular scope (e.g., 1 Global, 2 Europe). similar region argument old Red List API old versions rredlist. Also supports curl options passed GET request via HttpClient.

title: rredlist: 'IUCN' Red List Client — rredlist-package
text: 'IUCN' Red List (https://api.iucnredlist.org/) client. 'IUCN' Red List global list threatened endangered species. Functions cover Red List 'API' routes. 'API' key required.

title: rredlist: 'IUCN' Red List Client — rredlist-package
text: IUCN requires get API key, alphanumeric string need send every request. See key IUCN API token. See rl_use_iucn() help getting storing . Get https://api.iucnredlist.org/users/sign_up Keep key private. can pass key function via key parameter, better store key either environment variable (IUCN_REDLIST_KEY) R option (iucn_redlist_key) - recommend using former option.

what: High vs. Low level package APIs
title: rredlist: 'IUCN' Red List Client — rredlist-package
text: High level API High level functions HTTP request parse data data.frame ease downstream use. high level functions underscore end function name, e.g., rl_species() Low level API parsing data.frame high level API take extra time. low level API HTTP request, gives back JSON without parsing. low level functions underscore end function name, e.g., rl_species_()

title: rredlist (development version)
text: new major version rredlist tracks development IUCN Red List API. API upgraded v4 R package updated accordingly. Note nearly functionality package changed: functionality now revolves around retrieving individual lists assessments rather species Functions added, removed, renamed accordingly; existing endpoints new API covered structure returned data functions changed, reflecting change structure API Users need generate new API key use new version API (see rl_use_iucn()). package longer supports v3 IUCN Red List API. Older versions package may installed old version API needed.
